    • Method Detail

      • setCount

        public CpuTypes.UpdateSpec.Builder setCount(java.lang.Long count)
        New number of CPU cores. The number of CPU cores in the virtual machine must be a multiple of the number of cores per socket.

        The supported range of CPU counts is constrained by the configured guest operating system and virtual hardware version of the virtual machine.

        If the virtual machine is running, the number of CPU cores may only be increased if CpuTypes.Info.getHotAddEnabled() is true, and may only be decreased if CpuTypes.Info.getHotRemoveEnabled() is true.

        If null, the value is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        count - New value for the property.

      • setCoresPerSocket

        public CpuTypes.UpdateSpec.Builder setCoresPerSocket(java.lang.Long coresPerSocket)
        New number of CPU cores per socket. The number of CPU cores in the virtual machine must be a multiple of the number of cores per socket. If null, the value is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        coresPerSocket - New value for the property.

      • setHotAddEnabled

        public CpuTypes.UpdateSpec.Builder setHotAddEnabled(java.lang.Boolean hotAddEnabled)
        Flag indicating whether adding CPUs while the virtual machine is running is enabled.

        This property may only be modified if the virtual machine is powered off.

        If null, the value is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        hotAddEnabled - New value for the property.

      • setHotRemoveEnabled

        public CpuTypes.UpdateSpec.Builder setHotRemoveEnabled(java.lang.Boolean hotRemoveEnabled)
        Flag indicating whether removing CPUs while the virtual machine is running is enabled.

        This property may only be modified if the virtual machine is powered off.

        If null, the value is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        hotRemoveEnabled - New value for the property.

        public CpuTypes.UpdateSpec build()
